message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.CV. 

This paper is likely to belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category as it presents a method for training recurrent networks to perform tasks involving complex input/output transformations. The paper also discusses the use of additional input signals as task hints, which is a common technique in neural network training. 

The paper could also be classified under the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category as it presents a novel approach for modifying the connectivity matrix of a recurrent network to improve its performance on tasks. 

The Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category is also a possibility as the paper discusses the use of a second network to provide target dynamics for training the recurrent network, which could be seen as a form of artificial intelligence. 

The Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category is another possibility as the paper discusses the noise robustness of the trained networks, which is an important consideration in control systems. 

Finally, the Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV) sub-category is a possibility as the paper discusses the use of recurrent networks for processing complex input/output transformations, which is a common task in computer vision.
